inclusion.criterion: Histopathologically proven diagnosis of glioblastoma or gliosarcoma.
inclusion.label: not_met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, not glioblastoma or gliosarcoma.

inclusion.criterion: At least 1 block of tumor tissue available for submission to the central pathologist.
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention availability of tumor tissue blocks.

inclusion.criterion: Diagnosis must be established by open biopsy or tumor resection.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient underwent a biopsy and tumor resection, which is an open procedure.

inclusion.criterion: The tumor must have a supratentorial component.
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention the location of the tumor within the brain.

inclusion.criterion: Patients must have recovered from the effects of surgery, postoperative infection, and other complications before study registration.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of radiation therapy and chemotherapy, but it is unclear if they have fully recovered.

inclusion.criterion: All patients must sign an informed consent indicating that they are aware of the investigational nature of this study.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention informed consent, but it is assumed to be met.

inclusion.criterion: A diagnostic contrast-enhanced MRI or CT scan (if MRI is contraindicated) of the brain must be performed postoperatively in the period between surgery and initiation of radiation therapy.
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention a recent brain imaging study.

inclusion.criterion: Therapy must begin ≤5 weeks after the most recent brain tumor surgery.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of radiation therapy and chemotherapy, which began after their surgery.

inclusion.criterion: History/physical examination within 14 days prior to study registration.
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention a recent physical examination.

inclusion.criterion: Neurologic examination within 14 days prior to study registration.
inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention a recent neurologic examination.

inclusion.criterion: Documentation of steroid doses within 14 days prior to study registration and stable or decreasing steroid dose within 5 days prior to registration.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of high-dose steroids, but it is unclear if their current dose is stable.

inclusion.label: unknown
inclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention their Karnofsky score.

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient is 45 years old, which meets this criterion.

exclusion.criterion: Prior invasive malignancy (except for non-melanomatous skin cancer) unless disease-free for ≥3 years.
exclusion.label: triggers
exclusion.evidence: The patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, which is a prior invasive malignancy.

exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention recurrent or multifocal disease.

exclusion.criterion: Metastases detected below the tentorium or beyond the cranial vault.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention metastatic disease outside of the brain.

exclusion.criterion: Prior chemotherapy or radiosensitizers for cancers of the head and neck region; note that prior chemotherapy for a different cancer is allowable.
exclusion.label: met
exclusion.evidence: The patient has received chemotherapy, but it was not for a head and neck cancer.

exclusion.criterion: Prior use of Gliadel wafers or any other intratumoral or intracavitary treatment are not permitted.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention the use of Gliadel wafers.

exclusion.criterion: Prior radiotherapy to the head or neck (except for T1 glottic cancer), resulting in overlap of radiation fields.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention prior radiotherapy to the head or neck.

exclusion.criterion: Severe, active co-morbidity, defined as follows: Cardiac disease - Congestive heart failure > class II New York Heart Association (NYHA).
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention cardiac disease or congestive heart failure.

exclusion.criterion: Pregnancy or women of childbearing potential and men who are sexually active and not necessary because the treatment involved in this study may be significantly teratogenic.
exclusion.label: unknown
exclusion.evidence: The patient's text does not mention pregnancy or reproductive status.

notes: Key unknowns include the availability of tumor tissue blocks, recent brain imaging studies, and Karnofsky performance status. The patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma, which may trigger exclusion criteria related to prior invasive malignancy.
